metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11669 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.2 on the powerpcplatform. arch/powerpc/kernel/idle_book3s.S does not have save/restorefunctionality for PNV_POWERSAVE_AMR, PNV_POWERSAVE_UAMOR, andPNV_POWERSAVE_AMOR, aka CID-53a712bae5dd.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-101-generic - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-101-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-101-lowlatency - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-101-generic - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-101-lowlatency - 4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1067-aws - 4.15.0-1067.71~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1083-azure - 4.15.0-1083.93~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1039-oracle - 4.15.0-1039.43~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1020-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1020.23
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-101.102~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.71~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.93~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1039.43~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1020.23').
